meanings.definition: A prediction of what will happen in the future.
meanings.sent1: The ancient scroll contained many mysterious prophesies about the kingdom's fate.
meanings.sent2: She read the prophesies in the book and wondered if any would come true.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they made up silly prophesies about who would win the race.
meanings.sent4: Her prophesies were like whispers from the wind, carrying secrets of what was to come.
meanings.sent5: The prophesies of the wise old owl were always heeded by the villagers.

meanings.definition: The act of predicting future events.
meanings.sent1: His accurate prophesies amazed everyone in the town.
meanings.sent2: The study of prophesies has intrigued scholars for centuries.
meanings.sent3: The magician's prophesies were so spot-on that people thought he had magical powers.
meanings.sent4: The prophesies of the weatherman were as unpredictable as the changing seasons.
meanings.sent5: The prophesies of doom spread fear throughout the land.

meanings.definition: To predict or foretell future events.
meanings.sent1: The wise woman prophesies a bountiful harvest for the coming year.
meanings.sent2: He prophesies that the team will win the championship this season.
meanings.sent3: The fortune teller dramatically prophesies the fate of her clients with a crystal ball.
meanings.sent4: The ancient oracle prophesies the rise and fall of empires with cryptic messages.
meanings.sent5: The scientist prophesies a breakthrough in technology that will change the world.
